newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Qantas sees foreign share plan by AGM.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Qantas sees foreign share plan by AGM.

text.p: Qantas Airways Ltd chairman Gary Pemberton said on Thursday the airline expected to have a proposal to deal with its current foreign ownership restrictions by its annual meeting later in 1997.
Pemberton said Qantas was examining various options for dealing with the currently ad hoc arrangement for restricting foreign ownership of Qantas shares to below 50 percent.
"We have identified a number of options and we're thinking through the implications of those," Pemberton told a news conference after releasing the group's first half results.
Foreigners currently own about 48 percent of Qantas but the level of foreign shareholdings often exceeds 50 percent.
Under government imposed restrictions, foreigners cannot own more than 49 percent of Qantas.
"We are going to resolve this and we would expect to have something to present to the annual meeting," he said.
Whenever foreign ownership has exceeded 50 percent in the past, Qantas has had to issue a warning to shareholders, simply asking them to reduce their stakes.
Several options have been suggested, including the creation of a separate class of shares for foreign owners similar to the "A" and "B" class shares used by Air New Zealand.
British Airways owns about 25 percent of Qantas.
